titleStmt.title: An act for the better ordering and managing the estates of papists & delinquents. Die Veneris, 25 Januarii, 1649. Ordered by the Parliament, that John Field printer, nominated by Mr. Speaker, be joyned with Mr. Husbands stationer, in printing the Act for the better ordering and managing the estates of papists and delinquents, and all other acts and proceedings in Parliament; and that his name be used in printing of the said act, and all other acts and proceedings: and that the said John Field have equal benefit in printing accordingly. Hen: Scobell, Cleric. Parliamenti.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.

Ordered by the Parliament, that John Field printer, nominated by Mr. Speaker, be joyned with Mr. Husbands stationer, in printing the Act for the better ordering and managing the estates of papists and delinquents, and all other acts and proceedings in Parliament; and that his name be used in printing of the said act, and all other acts and proceedings: and that the said John Field have equal benefit in printing accordingly. projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: AN ACT FOR The better Ordering and Managing THE ESTATES OF Papi≈øts & Delinquents.

ORdered by the Parliament, That John Field Printer, nominated by Mr. Speaker, be joyned with Mr. Husbands Stationer, in Printing the Act for the better Ordering and Managing the E≈øtates of Papi≈øts and Delinquents, and all other Acts and Proceedings in Parliament; and that his Name be u≈øed in Printing of the ≈øaid Act, and all other Acts and Proceedings: And that the ≈øaid John Field have equal benefit in Printing accordingly.
London: Printed by Edward Hu≈øband and John Field, Printers to the Parliament of England, and are to be ≈øold at the Golden Dragon in Fleet≈øtreet. 1649.

div.head: AN ACT FOR The better Ordering and Managing THE ESTATES OF Papi≈øts & Delinquents.
div.p:
THe Parliament of England now a≈ø≈øembled being de≈øirous to improve the Seque≈øtrations, and the Profits ari≈øing thereupon, to the u≈øe of the Commonwealth, in order to ≈øome abatement of the A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øments, Do. Enact, and be it Enacted by the Authority afore≈øaid, That from and after the Twentieth day of December, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and nine, the ordering, managing, letting, ≈øetting and di≈øpo≈øing of the E≈øtates of Papi≈øts and Delinquents, ≈øhall be, and is hereby ≈øetled in the Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding with Delinquents, in ≈øuch ≈øort as is hereafter expre≈ø≈øed; and that the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, ≈øhall have and exerci≈øe all ≈øuch power and authority, in and about the Seque≈øtring, ordering and di≈øpo≈øing of ≈øuch E≈øtates, as have been formerly granted by any Ordinance
or Act of Parliament for Seque≈øtrations, to any Committee for Seque≈øtrations; and that the whole Rents, Revenues and Profits of the ≈øaid Seque≈øtrations and Seque≈øtred E≈øtates, ≈øhall be paid in to the Trea≈øury at Gold≈ømiths. hall, for the onely u≈øe, intent and purpo≈øe as is above≈øaid. And be it further Enacted, That the Committees for Seque≈øtrations, Solicitors, Trea≈øurers, Seque≈øtrators, Agents, Collectors, and all others herein concerned, in the ≈øeveral Counties and places within this Commonwealth, ≈øhall within ≈øix weeks after notice from the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, certifie by Duplicate one part unto the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, and the other to the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners to be appointed for Seque≈øtrations in the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Counties and places, the names of all and every per≈øon, as well Papi≈øts as Delinquents, who are or have been ≈øeque≈øtred, and what E≈øtate hath been ≈øo ≈øeque≈øtred and ≈øeized, and when; and for ≈øuch as have been ≈øince di≈øcharged from Seque≈øtration, or the Seque≈øtrations taken off or ≈øu≈øpended, either by the Committees of the re≈øpective Counties or otherwi≈øe, to certifie when, how, and by what means the ≈øame were di≈øcharged, taken off or ≈øu≈øpended; and for ≈øuch as do ≈øtill remain under Seque≈øtration, to certifie what E≈øtates they have, and in what Towns and Pari≈øhes, and what Lea≈øes have been made of the ≈øaid E≈øtates, and to whom, and for what time, and under what Rent, and what Charges and Incumbrances do lie upon the ≈øaid E≈øtates, and what allowances and defalkations have been made out of any ≈øuch E≈øtates, and to whom, and by what Order or Warrant, and what Rents, and arrerages
of Rent, and other profits of the Lands or E≈øtates of the ≈øaid Papi≈øts or Delinquents, do remain in the hands of any the Seque≈øtrators, or any of their Officers or Agents, and what Rents and profits thereof remain in the hands of any of the Tenants of the ≈øaid Lands; which particulars ≈øhall be returned and certified in ≈øuch maner and form as ≈øhall be from time to time directed by the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding. And be it Enacted by the authority afore≈øaid, That from and after the Five and twentieth day of January, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and nine, All Committees for Seque≈øtrations, Trea≈øurers and Solicitors for Seque≈øtrations, and all and every per≈øon and per≈øons imployed by them, or any of them, in and about the ≈øaid Seque≈øtrations, or ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, ≈øhall cea≈øe and forbear to act in and about the ≈øaid Seque≈øtrations, by vertue or colour of any the Orders and Ordinances of Seque≈øtrations heretofore made; and ≈øhall not from henceforth let, ≈øet, ≈øeque≈øter, ≈øeize or di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, or any part thereof; nor ≈øhall receive any Rents, or other profits of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, or any part thereof; nor ≈øhall make any Wood-≈øales, or fell any Woods, or Vnderwoods, Timber or Trees, in or upon the ≈øame E≈øtates; nor ≈øhall make payment or allowance of any Rents or charges impo≈øed or lying upon the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, but that the managing, letting, ≈øetting, di≈øpo≈øing and ordering of the ≈øaid E≈øtates, ≈øhall be in the Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, and in ≈øuch per≈øons as ≈øhall be by them from time to time nominated and appointed: And that the
≈øaid Seque≈øtrators, Trea≈øurers and Solicitors for Seque≈øtrations, and all other per≈øons imployed by them; and all and every the Farmers and Tenants of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, and all other per≈øons that have any part of the Rents, or other profits of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates in their hands, ≈øhall forthwith pay the ≈øame to the Trea≈øurers of the ≈øaid Trea≈øury at Gold≈ømiths-Hall; who≈øe Acquittance ≈øhall be a ≈øufficient di≈øcharge to the ≈øaid parties ≈øo paying in the ≈øame, for ≈øo much as ≈øhall be ≈øo paid in by them as afore≈øaid; and if they or any of them ≈øhall make default, or neglect to pay the ≈øame as afore≈øaid, before the fir≈øt day of April, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fifty, That they and every of them ≈øo making default, ≈øhall forfeit unto the Commonwealth, ≈øo much more as the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding ≈øhal think fit, not exceeding the moyety of ≈øuch Moneys as ≈øhall be di≈øcovered to be remaining in any of their hands, or due from them upon Accompt, to be levyed upon their Lands, Goods and Chattels, by Order of the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding: And all Committees, Solicitors, Seque≈øtrators, and others appointed by any former Ordinance or Act of Parliament, are hereby required to ≈øuffer ≈øuch per≈øons as ≈øhall be appointed Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations by the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, to peru≈øe their Books and Papers, that ≈øo they may be the better enabled to carry on the work of Seque≈øtration again≈øt Delinquents: And if the ≈øaid Committees, Solicitors, Seque≈øtrators, or others imployed by them, refu≈øe to yield obedience to this, or any other matter or thing in
this Act required, Then the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, are hereby enabled and required to ≈øend for ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, or otherwi≈øe to cau≈øe them to be kept in ≈øafe cu≈øtody, until ≈øuch time as they ≈øhall conform them≈øelves in the premi≈øes, and ≈øhall pay ≈øuch Fine as ≈øhall be impo≈øed on them by the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, ≈øo as the ≈øaid Fine exceed not the ≈øum of Forty pounds for any one offence. And it is further Enacted, That the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈ø√©ven of them, ≈øhall nominate, ≈øub≈øtitute and appoint, under their or any ≈øeven of their hands and Seals, ≈øuch and ≈øo many fit and able per≈øons in every county, city and place within this Commonwealth, being Inhabitants there, as have adhered to the Parliament from the beginning of the late Wars unto this day, to be Commi≈øsioners for Seque≈øtrations within the ≈øaid ≈øeveral and re≈øpectioned, as they ≈øhall ≈øee fit; As al≈øo ≈øuch other Officers and Agents, as ≈øhall be nece≈ø≈øary for the carrying on of this ≈øervice, and to remove any of them as they ≈øhall ≈øee cau≈øe; which ≈øaid per≈øons ≈øo nominated, ≈øub≈øtituted and appointed to be Commi≈øsioners for Seque≈øtrations as afore≈øaid, or ≈øo many of them as the Commi≈øsiouers for Compounding ≈øhall appoint, ≈øhall according to ≈øuch In≈øtructions and Orders, in pur≈øuance of any Acts or Ordinances of Parliament, as they ≈øhall from time to time receive from the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, in pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Acts and Ordinances, Seque≈øter into the hands of the Commonwealth,
the E≈øtates of all Papi≈øts in Arms, and other Delinquents, and two parts in three parts to be divided, of the E≈øtates of all other Papi≈øts as are already adjudged to be Delinquents or Papi≈øts re≈øpectively, or ≈øhall by the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding be adjudged to be ≈øuch; and enter into and Survey the ≈øame. E≈øtates, and con≈øider how the ≈øame E≈øtates may be improved, to the be≈øt advantage of the Commonwealth, and what profits may conveniently be rai≈øed by Wood≈øales, or otherwi≈øe out of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates, and ≈øhall certifie the ≈øame to the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding; by and according to who≈øe Order and Direction, grounded upon ≈øuch Survey and Certificate as afore≈øaid, The ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations, or ≈øo many of them as the Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding ≈øhall appoint as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall or may contract for the ≈øame ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates of Delinquents and Papi≈øts in Arms, or any part thereof, to be letten to ≈øuch fit and able per≈øon or per≈øons as will give the be≈øt Rent for the ≈øame, for any term not exceeding the number of Seven years in po≈ø≈øe≈øsion, for ≈øuch yearly Rent as ≈øhall be agreed upon, if the E≈øtate of ≈øuch Delinquents or Papi≈øts in Arms ≈øhall ≈øo long continue, the ≈øaid Rent to be paid according to the u≈øual days of payment, to the ≈øaid Trea≈øurers at Gold≈ømiths-Hall; and the ≈øaid Lea≈øes either to be made under the Hands and Seals of the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, or under the Hands and Seals of the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations, as ≈øhall be appointed by Order of the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of
them; and that the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations, or ≈øo many of them as the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding ≈øhall appoint, ≈øhall keep or cau≈øe to be kept Courts within the ≈øeveral ≈øeque≈øtred Manors, and grant Copyhold E≈øtates, according to the Cu≈øtoms of the ≈øaid Manors, and a≈ø≈øe≈øs and receive Fines for the ≈øame E≈øtates to be ≈øo granted, according to the Cu≈øtoms, or to the Rules to be therein pre≈øcribed by the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them; Which ≈øaid Copyhold E≈øtates ≈øo granted, ≈øhall be good and effectual to the Tenant ≈øo admitted, again≈øt the party ≈øeque≈øtred, and again≈øt all claiming by, from or under him or his E≈øtate: And that the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations ≈øhall further act in and about the premi≈øes, according to ≈øuch further In≈øtructions and Directions as ≈øhall be given unto them, in pur≈øuance of this Act, by the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, as any occa≈øion or exigent ≈øhall require. And that the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Seque≈øtrations ≈øhall have and retain to their own u≈øe for their Salary, Twelve pence in the pound of all ≈øuch Moneys as ≈øhall be paid by them into the Trea≈øury at Gold≈ømiths Hall, out of the Profits of the ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates in the re≈øpective Counties and places; And that the other Officers that ≈øhall be named by the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, ≈øhall have ≈øuch Salary and Allowance as the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them ≈øhall think fit. And be it further Enacted by the Authority of this pre≈øent Parliament, That the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, ≈øhall have full
power to receive from any per≈øon or per≈øons, who ≈øhall pre≈øent the ≈øame unto them, All and every Act, Ordinance or Orders of Parliament, whereby any charge is laid upon the Seque≈øtrations, or ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtate of any ≈øuch Papi≈øt or Delinquent, and to examine the grounds and natures of them, and to ≈øtate the cau≈øe, and make ≈øpecial Report thereof to the Parliament for their Allowance or Di≈øcharge, or for their further Order and Directions therein, as the Parliament ≈øhall ≈øee cau≈øe; And ≈øhall al≈øo examine all Rents, Quitrents, Outrents and I≈ø≈øues that ≈øhall be pretended to be due and payable out of any ≈øuch E≈øtate, and the nature of them; as al≈øo all Conveyances and A≈ø≈øurances of, and all other Charges, Incumbrances or Ingagements upon the ≈øaid E≈øtates, or any part thereof, and to give allowance thereof, if it ≈øhall appear that the ≈øame were bona fide made or charged before the cau≈øe of ≈øuch Seque≈øtration committed. And it is further Enacted, That the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, or any ≈øeven of them, ≈øhall have power to allow unto the Wives and Children of ≈øuch Papi≈øts in arms, and other Delinquents who≈øe E≈øtates ≈øhall remain under Seque≈øtration by vertue of this Act, one Fifth part of their ≈øaid ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates for their ≈øub≈øi≈øtence. And be it further Enacted by the Authority afore≈øaid, That the Clerk of the late Committee of the Lords and Commons for Seque≈øtrations, ≈øhall forthwith certifie unto the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, the Names of all ≈øuch per≈øons who≈øe E≈øtates or any part thereof, having been ≈øeque≈øtred, either for Delinquency or Recu≈øancy, have upon their Appeals had the Seque≈øtrations of
their E≈øtates ≈øu≈øpended or taken off, either by the ≈øaid Committees of Lords and Commons, or by the Barons of the Exchequer; and the Names of all ≈øuch per≈øons as have upon their Appeals been Voted to be Delinquents, and to certifie the places of their abodes; and the Names of all ≈øuch per≈øons as now remain before the Barons of the Exchequer, upon their Appeals not yet determined, and the time when the ≈øaid parties Appealing did pre≈øent their ≈øeveral Petitions and Appeals unto the Barons of the Exchequer; And the ≈øaid Barons are hereby required to take care that Certificate be made accordingly before the Five and twentieth day of February, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and nine; and that all ≈øuch who≈øe E≈øtates have upon their Appeals been ≈øu≈øpended from Seque≈øtration by any Order from the late Committee of Lords and Commons for Seque≈øtrations, or otherwi≈øe, who≈øe Ca≈øes ≈øhall not be determined before the Fir≈øt day of March, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and nine, The ≈øaid ≈øu≈øpen≈øion ≈øhall be void, and the Seque≈øtration again laid upon their E≈øtates. And it is hereby further Enacted, That the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits of all ≈øeque≈øtred E≈øtates remaining in the hands of any Committees, Trea≈øurers, Seque≈øtrators, Solicitors, Tenants, or other per≈øons what≈øoever, ≈øhall be accompted for, and an≈øwered unto the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners for Compounding, and ≈øhall be ≈øatisfied and paid unto the ≈øaid Trea≈øurers at Gold≈ømiths-Hall, and not unto any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, Any other Act, Ordinance or Provi≈øion to the contrary notwith≈øtanding. And be it further Enacted, That all ≈øuch per≈øons who have been ≈øeque≈øtred
≈øince the Fir≈øt day of Augu≈øt, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and nine, or hereafter ≈øhall be ≈øeque≈øtred for any Delinquency committed before the making of this Act; And all other per≈øons who upon the pro≈øecution of their Appeals, have been or ≈øhall be adjudged Delinquents within the times herein before limited, ≈øhall upon their Petitions be admitted to Compo≈øition re≈øpectively, according to the late Votes of Parliament of the Fourteenth and One and twentieth of March, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred forty and eight, ≈øo as they do pro≈øecute their Compo≈øitions with effect, within ≈øix weeks after they ≈øhall be adjudged Delinquents as afore≈øaid. And it is further Enacted and Ordained, That the Right, Title and Intere≈øt of all ≈øuch Rectories, Tythes, Portions of Tythes, and other Profits and advantages as have been, or hereafter ≈øhall, upon the Compo≈øition of any Delinquent or Delinquents, be ≈øetled to or for the Benefit of any Mini≈øter or Church, by the Committee or Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, ≈øhall be good and effectual to all intents and purpo≈øes, and ≈øhall be enjoyed again≈øt ≈øuch Delinquent and Delinquents, and all claiming by, from or under him or them; or by, from or under any per≈øon or per≈øons in tru≈øt for him or them, or to his or their u≈øe, benefit or behoof, ≈øince the cau≈øe of Seque≈øtration; and al≈øo again≈øt all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons claiming any e≈øtate therein, who ≈øhall not make ≈øuch his E≈øtate and Claim appear unto the ≈øaid Commi≈øsioners for Compounding, within the time of one year after his Right or Title ≈øhall accrew and grow due, or before the Fir≈øt day of June, One
thou≈øand ≈øix hundred fifty five. And be it further Enacted by the authority afore≈øaid, That all the Lands of Papi≈øts that are under Seque≈øtration for Delinquency or Recu≈øancy, as al≈øo the third part that remains to the Recu≈øant; ≈øhall be, and hereby are di≈øcharged of and from all former Fines and Compo≈øitions for Recu≈øancy, and of and from all the Arrears due upon the ≈øame, ≈øince the ≈øaid Lands have been under Seque≈øtration: And the Barons of the Exchequer, and all others whom it may concern are to take notice hereof.

Provided always, and be it Enacted by the authority afore≈øaid, That this Act, nor any thing therein contained, doth or ≈øhall extend to the taking away of all or any the powers heretofore granted to the Committee for advance of Money, commonly called, The Committee of Haberda≈øhers-Hall.
